text.0: agni that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold.
text.1: the people of the maruts i call down today even from the luminous realm of heaven.
text.2: even as thou thinkest in thy heart thither my wishes also tend.
text.3: those who have come most near to thine invoking calls strengthen them fearful to behold.
text.4: earth like a bounteous lady liberal of her gifts struck down and shaken yet exultant comes to us.
text.5: impetuous as a bear o maruts is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull.
text.6: they who with mighty strength oerthrow like oxen difficult to yoke.
text.7: cause een the heavenly stone to shake  yea shake the rocky mountain as they race along.
text.8: rise up even now with lauds i call the very numerous company.
text.9: unequalled of these maruts like a herd of kine grown up together in their strength.
text.10: bind to your car the bright red mares yoke the red coursers to your car.
text.11: bind to the pole to draw the fleetfoot tawny steeds the best at drawing to the pole.
text.12: yea and this loudlyneighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned fair to see.
text.13: let him not cause delay o maruts in your course urge ye him onward in your cars.
text.14: the maruts chariot ever fain to gather glory we invoke.
text.15: which rodasī hath mounted bringing pleasant gifts with maruts in her company.
text.16: i call that brilliant band of yours adorable rapid on the car.
text.17: whereon the bounteous dame auspicious nobly born shows glorious with the marut host.
